column4: If you don't have same name on linux as on the windows login, make the sharing on windows box accessible to all.
both boxes are running ubuntu
You need on at least one of them the samba daemon then and not just the default which is the client
ssh and then fish:/ in file browser
You need to actually have samba installed in order to use smbpasswd. As I said only smbclient is on default install. One box at least needs the server of it.
what is the name of the packange i need to install ?
Just samba
Synaptic or Add/Remove?
As you like.
but what about security?
and why should I use a protocol that is used for linux to windows communication?
the ssharing i am after is linux to linux
Then why were you asking about smb:/ ??
I wasn't asking about samba, joh mentioned it as an easy way to do it..
I was asking about a way to transfer files between to linux boxes..
GUI or terminal ?
Nautilus for instance
so I need to install ssh and then youse fish:/local.ip ?
Nautilus cannot handle fish: locations.
I'm normally in KDE here so I would be using Konqueror. But there must be one in Gnome that works by default as well
In commandline you can do like:      sshfs name@remote:dir /local/mountpoint
